title: Co-Lab
content:
APEST Co-Lab

A Collaborative Environment for APEST Learning

Join the APEST Co-Lab

Where the APEST Journey Continues...

The Co-Lab is a group where APEST practitioners come together to explore fivefold paradigms, discover new practices, share struggles and breakthroughs, and forge meaningful connections. 

Wether you're seeking to deepen your application of APEST, looking for a group of like-minded individuals, or eager to share your insights and learn from others, this group is a great place to share your APEST journey with others on the same path. To join the Co-Lab simply click the "Join the Co-Lab" button below and fill out the interest form. We'll schedule a time to connect and get you in!

Join the Co-Lab

What is the APEST Co-Lab?

The APEST Co-Lab is a unique, twice a month online gathering designed for individuals passionate about exploring and applying APEST in their personal and community life. It’s like a meetup group, a community of practice, and a Mastermind group, all rolled into one!

Meet and Connect

Our Co-Lab is a great place to meet others who share your interest in APEST. Exchange ideas, form connections, and build a network of peers who are just as passionate about APEST as you are. Each session will include 10-15 minute Zoom breakouts specifically focused on connecting with others from different contexts around their APEST journey.

Community of Practice

Dive into a collaborative space where you can share resources, strategies, and real-life experiences from your APEST journey. Learn from the successes and challenges of fellow practitioners, enrich your understanding, and refine your approach to APEST. Together, we’ll grow and evolve as a community.


Mastermind Access

Access customized coaching and mentoring from Tim Catchim, a leading expert in APEST! Each session, Tim presents content, facilitates discussion, and offers personal insights, guidance, and practical advice to help you tailor the application of APEST to your unique context. This is a rare opportunity to receive personalized support and accelerate your journey as an APEST practitioner.

When & Where?

The APEST Co-Lab meets every second and third Thursday of the month at 12:00 noon EST via Zoom. It’s an interactive, engaging, and empowering session designed to fit into your busy schedule.

Ready to Join?

Don’t miss this chance to be part of a vibrant, collaborative community of APEST practitioners! For more details, check out the FAQ section below. The cost is only $14.99 a month. 

To join the Co-Lab simply click the “Join the Co-Lab” button below and fill out the interest form. We’ll schedule a time to connect and get you in

Join the Co-Lab

Frequently Asked Questions

Who is the APEST Co-Lab for?

It’s ideal for anyone interested in personal and ministry growth in APEST. Whether you’re new to APEST or seeking to deepen your practice, you’ll find value here.

Do I need prior knowledge of APEST to join?

The Co-Lab is designed to be accessible to beginners while also offering deep insights for those already familiar with APEST. However, a basic knowledge of APEST is helpful.

What can I expect from the online meetings?

Each session is a mix of networking, collaborative learning, and expert coaching. You’ll connect with peers, share resources and experiences, ask questions, and receive personalized feedback from Tim.

Who leads the Co-Lab sessions?

Tim will lead the majority of the Co-Lab sessions. However, occassionally we will create space for other APEST practitioners to make presentations or facilitate discission around key areas of their expertise to enrich the Co-Lab experience.

What level of personalized feedback or coaching can I expect from Tim Catchim in the Co-Lab?

Although the Co-Lab is a group setting, there’s a structured element for individuals in each gathering. Participants are encouraged to share challenges and ask questions, and Tim offers personalized feedback and coaching to each person as much as the session’s time and structure allow.

But keep in mind that there’s a valuable learning opportunity in this group dynamic. Even when Tim is addressing a question from another participant, his feedback often resonates with common challenges or interests of other individuals, providing learning moments for everyone.

This format enhances the collective learning experience, ensuring everyone benefits from each interaction. For those seeking more in-depth, one-on-one coaching or consulting, separate individual sessions can be arranged.

How does the Co-Lab facilitate networking and collaboration among participants?

The sessions are interactive with breakout sessions, group discussions, opportunities for Q&A, live activities, and dedicated networking time in each meeting. This allows participants to connect, share insights, and potentially collaborate on projects or initiatives. We encourage active participation to enhance the learning experience.

How can I contribute to the Co-Lab community?

We encourage sharing your experiences, resources, and insights during the meetings. Active participation helps enrich the learning experience for everyone.

What if I miss a live session? Are the Co-Lab sessions recorded?

We understand that schedules can be busy, and you might not be able to attend every live session. However, to maintain the privacy and comfort of all participants, sessions are not recorded.

But don’t worry! If you miss a session, we encourage you to connect with other members in the Co-Lab. They can help catch you up on what was discussed, share notes, and collaborate on any exercises or activities. This approach also fosters stronger community bonds and collaborative learning within the Co-Lab.

How much does it cost to join the Co-Lab?

Joining the Co-Lab community is an investment in your growth as an APEST practitioner, with a subscription of just $14.99 a month. This allows us to provide you with valuable resources, expert-led sessions, and a supportive network dedicated to your development.

Ready to get started? Just click Join and we’ll start this transformative journey together.

Can I share my Co-Lab membership with others?

Each Co-Lab membership is intended for individual use to ensure a personalized experience. We encourage everyone interested to sign up individually.

How does the content evolve over time? Is it suitable for long-term participants?

The APEST Co-Lab’s content not only reflects the multi-faceted nature of APEST, it’s also participant-driven. APEST intersects with personal growth, team dynamics, group development, and organizational design, as well as various aspects of theology and Scripture. In our sessions, we explore these diverse aspects, ensuring that there’s always something new and relevant for every participant.

To keep the content fresh and aligned with the needs and interests of our members, we actively solicit input from participants about the topics they’re most interested in discussing. This approach allows us to tailor the Co-Lab sessions to the evolving interests and challenges faced by the group.

Whether it’s deepening personal understanding, enhancing group or team dynamics, embedding APEST in organizational strategies, or situating APEST within the larger context of Ephesians and the rest of Scripture, the nature and scope of the content and conversations will adjust to explore the way these aspects overlap and inform each other.

As a result, the Co-Lab can remain continually relevant and engaging, providing long-term value to both new and seasoned participants.

In what ways does the Co-Lab support ongoing personal and leadership development in APEST?

The Co-Lab is not just a series of meetings; it’s a continuous journey of growth with others who are realizing the full potential of APEST in their context. We provide ongoing support, resources, and a community that nurtures long-term development in APEST paradigms and practices, ensuring we all continue to advance along God’s develomental path outlined for us in Christ.

How long is each Zoom session?

Sessions typically last about 45 -60 minutes, ensuring they are comprehensive, yet concise enough to fit into your schedule.

How often does the Co-Lab meet?

The Co-Lab meets twice a month on second and third Thursdays at 12 noon EST, with occasional alternative scheduling to accommodate holidays.

How do I join the APEST Co-Lab?

Just click the “Join” button below and fill out your details. You’ll receive a confirmation email with all the necessary information.

How can I ensure I'm getting the most value out of the Co-Lab

Engage actively in each session, utilize the provided resources, and connect with the community. Remember, the more you participate, the more you gain!

Is there a commitment period for the Co-Lab membership?

No long-term commitment is required. You can join with a monthly subscription and cancel anytime.

For more information on cancellations and refunds, see our ‘Terms and Conditons’.

Join the Co-Lab
